intro: Lippia schlechtendalii, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom during the summer months. Lippia schlechtendalii is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
